alert.note: Alert for Clark (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 9:25PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Nevada, including the following county, Clark. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 923 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated another area of heavy rain due to a thunderstorm has moved over the Las Vegas Strip. This will only act to exacerbate the ongoing street flooding in the area. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Las Vegas, The Strip, Paradise, East Las Vegas, Enterprise, Mccarran International Airport, UNLV and Stratosphere Tower. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
